item.title: List Running Desktop Applications with PowerShell
item.description: Here’s a quick PowerShell tip… TL;DR Have you ever wanted to get a list of running desktop applications in PowerShell? Maybe you want to see what you have open but would rather not fumble around with Task Manager? Here’s a one-liner to do just that: gps | ? { $_.MainWindowTitle } Sample output: Handles NPM(K) PM(K) WS(K) CPU(s) Id SI ProcessName ------- ------ ----- ----- ------ -- -- ----------- 4269 188 382940 424100 1,336.
